Washington is home to tech giants like Amazon, Microsoft, and Starbucks, yet also to vast agricultural regions and stunning natural beauty. Vouch Mobile connects all of Washington—from Seattle's tech campuses to the apple orchards of Wenatchee.

Network

AT&T Coverage in Washington

Vouch Mobile operates on AT&T's award-winning network, providing Washington residents with reliable 5G and LTE coverage across the Evergreen State. With 98% population coverage, you'll stay connected wherever you go.

According to the FCC Broadband Map, AT&T provides extensive wireless coverage throughout Washington, including urban centers and many rural areas.

Benefits

Why Washington Residents Choose Vouch

Washington's average phone bill of $118/month is above the national average—Vouch cuts that by 75%.

Whether you're commuting on I-5, working in Seattle's tech scene, or exploring the Cascades, you need coverage that keeps up.

No credit check means UW students, new Seattle residents, and Amazon warehouse workers can sign up instantly.

AT&T's network covers Washington from Puget Sound to the Columbia Basin, with excellent coverage in the Seattle metro.

    FAQ

    Washington Coverage Questions

    Everything you need to know about Vouch Mobile in Washington

    Yes! Vouch Mobile provides 98% population coverage across Washington using AT&T's network. From Seattle to Spokane, Tacoma to Tri-Cities, you'll have reliable 5G and LTE service throughout the Evergreen State.

    Vouch Mobile operates on AT&T's network in Washington. AT&T provides extensive 5G coverage in the Seattle metro and Spokane, plus reliable LTE across the state.

    Vouch Mobile costs $30/month for unlimited talk, text, and data—no matter where you live in Washington. The average Washingtonian pays $118/month for phone service, so you could save over $1,056 per year by switching to Vouch.

    No credit check required. Whether you're a UW student, a new Seattle resident, or rebuilding your credit, you can sign up for Vouch Mobile instantly.

    Switching is easy: check that your phone is unlocked, order a free Vouch SIM card shipped to your Washington address, then activate online in minutes. You can keep your existing phone number—we'll handle the port.

    Yes! 5G is available in Seattle, Tacoma, Bellevue, Spokane, Vancouver, and many other Washington cities. Your 5G access is included free with your $30/month plan.

    Yes. AT&T's network covers communities across Washington, including the Columbia Basin, Yakima Valley, and most smaller towns. Coverage may vary in remote mountain or forest areas.

    Coverage on Washington State Ferries varies. You'll have service at terminals and typically maintain connection on routes close to shore. Open water crossings may have limited coverage.
